intro: Verbascum lychnitis var. giganteum, commonly known as the giant mullein, is a striking plant characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in a terminal spike. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its robust structure and unique appearance make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
